<url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;84fcbcb7.1503">   <title>Workshop on The use of Phylogenies in the Study of Macroevolution, Sep 28 Oct 2, Barcelona (Spain) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;84fcbcb7.1503</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Registration is open for the course &quot;THE USE OF PHYLOGENIES IN THE STUDY OF MACROEVOLUTION -\ufffd\ufffd 3rd edition&quot;, Septiembre 28-October 2, 2015.\ufffd\ufffdInstructor: Dr. Juan L\ufffd\ufffdpez Cantalapiedra (Museo de Ciencias Naturales, CSIC, Spain).<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>New phylogenetic methods would allow us to draw on the information encapsulated in phylogenetic trees in order to address a wide range of questions on macroevolution. First, this course will introduce participants to the use, modification and representation of phylogenetic trees. Then, we will focus on the use of phylogenetic information to reconstruct ancestral characters and biogeographic histories, learning how to apply phylogenetic comparative [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T09:45:26+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>soledad.esteban</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;84fcbcb7.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;84832ee4.1502">   <title>Stats course: GAM and GAMM in Genoa, Italy </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;84832ee4.1502</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>We would like to announce the following statistics course:<br><br>Course: Introduction to GAM and GAMM with R<br>Location: University of Genoa, Italy<br>Date: 11 - 15 May 2015.<br>Price: 425 GBP<br><br>Course website: http://www.highstat.com/statscourse.htm<br>Course flyer: http://www.highstat.com/Courses/Flyer2015_05Genua.pdf<br><br>Kind regards,<br><br>Alain Zuur   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T10:16:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Highland Statistics Ltd</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;84832ee4.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;5530d73.1502">   <title>Genetic data analysis using R - STATISTICS COURSE </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;5530d73.1502</link>   <description> This 5 day course will be held at SCENE (Scottish Centre for Ecology and the Natural Environment), Glasgow, United Kingdom from August 3rd - 7th 2015<br><br>The course is being delivered by Dr. Thibaut Jombart who has contributed towards a number of R packages (adegenet, adephylo, geography, outbreaker, Outbreakertools, bmmix, episerve (author) and ade4 and phylobase (contributor) and Caitlin Collins (Imperial College London) who also contributes to the R packages adegenet, Outbreakertools and episerve) [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-17T20:27:13+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oliver Hooker</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;5530d73.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;5f27097a.1502">   <title>Biogeography workshop, June 15-19, Barcelona, Spain </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;5f27097a.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleague,<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>There are still some places available for the course \ufffd\ufffd&quot;HISTORICAL BIOGEOGRAPHY: FUNDAMENTALS AND APPLICATIONS&quot;, June 15-19, 2015.<br>INSTRUCTORS: Dr.\ufffd\ufffdLone Aagesen\ufffd\ufffd(IBODA, CONICET, Argentina) and Dr. Claudia A. Szumik (Miguel Lillo Foundation, CONICET, Argentina).<br><br>PLACE:\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFacilities of the Centre of Restauraci\ufffd\ufffd i Interpretaci\ufffd\ufffd Paleontologica, Els Hostalets de Pierola,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdBarcelona (Spain).<br><br>WEBPAGE AND REGISTRATION: http://www.transmittingscience.org/courses/biog/historic-biogeography/<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>PROGRAM:<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Topic 1.\ufffd\ufffdHistorical Background:<br>- The connection to cladistics. Basic concepts of cladistic methods. Optimality criteria in systematics and its connection to biogeography. How to manage space.<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Topic 2. Raw Data:<br>- Distribution maps. Errors in databases. Georeferencing and how to measure the error [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T10:38:50+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>soledad.esteban</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;5f27097a.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;6b35b91a.1502">   <title>GIS in ecological field studies COURSE </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;6b35b91a.1502</link>   <description> GIS course: Introduction to using GIS in ecological field studies.<br>This course will be held at SCENE (Scottish Centre for Ecology and the Natural Environment), Glasgow, United Kingdom from July 27th \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 30th 2015<br><br>This course is aimed at biologists and ecologists who are just starting to use GIS in their ecological data collection and analysis and who have little or no existing knowledge of this subject area. The course will cover areas such as making a map for a paper or a report, extracting information from Google Earth for use in a GIS project, collecting GIS-compatible data using a [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-02T17:46:33+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oliver Hooker</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;6b35b91a.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;632a47ce.1501">   <title>Statistics courses in Australia </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;632a47ce.1501</link>   <description> Hello,<br><br>In July/August/September 2015 we will be running again a series of<br>statistics courses in Australia.<br><br>Confirmed courses:<br><br>1. Darwin: Data exploration, regression, GLM and GAM with introduction to R<br>2. Sydney: Introduction to mixed modelling, GLMM and MCMC with R<br>3. Canberra: Introduction to mixed modelling, GLMM and MCMC with R<br>4. Phillip Island Nature Parks: Data exploration and visualisation with<br>R (with introduction to R) [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-28T16:29:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Highland Statistics Ltd</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;632a47ce.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;edab9b6c.1501">   <title>Stable Isotope Analysis statistics course </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;edab9b6c.1501</link>   <description> Statistics course: Analysis of Stable Isotope data using SIA-R<br>This course will be held at SCENE (Scottish Centre for Ecology and the Natural Environment), Glasgow, United Kingdom from July 27th \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 30th 2015<br><br>This course will cover the concepts, technical background and use of stable isotope mixing models (SIMMs) with a particular focus on running them in R. Recently SIMMs have become a very popular tool for quantifying food webs and thus the diet of predators and prey in an ecosystem.<br>Course content is as follows; [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-19T21:17:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oliver Hooker</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;edab9b6c.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;ab1b0fe0.1501">   <title>Two stats courses in Portugal </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;ab1b0fe0.1501</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>There are 5 remaining seats available on each of the following two courses:<br><br>Data exploration, regression, GLM &amp; GAM with introduction to R.<br>2 - 6 February 2015. Coimbra, Portugal<br><br>Introduction to Linear mixed effects models, GLMM and MCMC with R<br>9-13 February 2015. Lisbon, Portugal<br><br>For registration, course flyers and further information:<br>http://www.highstat.com/statscourse.htm [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-13T10:41:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Highland Statistics Ltd</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;ab1b0fe0.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;65ed898e.1412">   <title>Workshop on Individual Based Models in Ecology using Netlogo,June 15-19, Spain. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;65ed898e.1412</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Registration\ufffd\ufffdis open for the course &quot;INTRODUCTION TO INDIVIDUAL BASED MODELS IN ECOLOGY USING NETLOGO&quot;, June 15-19, 2015.<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Instructors:\ufffd\ufffdDr. J\ufffd\ufffdrgen Groeneveld (Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research - UFZ, Germany) and Dr. Alexander Singer\ufffd\ufffd (Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research - UFZ, Germany).\ufffd\ufffd<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Site: Facilities of CRIP at Els Hostalets de Pierola, Barcelona, Spain. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-16T16:02:17+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>soledad.esteban</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;65ed898e.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;9b6977b3.1412">   <title>8 statistics course; January - June 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;9b6977b3.1412</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>We would like to announce the following 8 statistics course covering<br>topics such as R, data exploration (using lattice and ggplot2), multiple<br>linear regression, GLM, GAM, mixed modelling, GLMM, GAMM, Bayesian<br>analysis and MCMC. For further information, registration, prices, course<br>flyers, etc., see:<br><br>http://www.highstat.com/statscourse.htm<br><br>List of open courses in January - June 2015:<br><br>Data exploration, regression, GLM &amp; GAM with introduction to R.<br>2 - 6 February 2015. Coimbra, Portugal [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-04T14:48:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Highland Statistics Ltd</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;9b6977b3.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;cd4734cf.1412">   <title>Course about Cladistic Analysis by Dr. Goloboff in Barcelona, Spain. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;cd4734cf.1412</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Registration is open for the workshop &quot;QUANTITATIVE CLADISTICS AND USE OF TNT - 2nd Edition&quot;, June 29 - July 3, 2015. Instructors: Dr. Goloboff and Dr. Szumik (Conicet, Argentine).<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>PLACE:\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFacilities of the Centre de Restauraci\ufffd\ufffd i Interpretaci\ufffd\ufffd Paleontologica, Els Hostalets de Pierola,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdBarcelona (Spain).<br><br>WEBPAGE: http://www.transmittingscience.org/courses/phylo/cladistics/<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>PROGRAM:<br>- Intro and Basics. Parsimony and phylogenetic systematics. Character optimisation and mapping. Most parsimonious reconstructions and specific changes. Input/output in TNT. Dataset formats. Using GB->TNT to create matrices. Instruction files. Options for graphic output (SVG, metafiles). Creation of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdbatch\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd files. Editing trees. Handling tree files. Groups of trees, characters [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-02T17:10:45+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>soledad.esteban</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;cd4734cf.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;29c92abd.1411">   <title>Course Introduction to Networks tools in Biosciences, April 20-24, Barcelona. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;29c92abd.1411</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Registration is open for the course &quot;INTRODUCTION TO NETWORK TOOLS IN BIOSCIENCES - 2nd Edition&quot;. Webpage:\ufffd\ufffdhttp://www.transmittingscience.org/courses/syst-bio/networks/<br><br>INSTRUCTORS: Dr. Diego Rasskin-Gutman\ufffd\ufffd(Institut Cavanilles de Biodiversitat i Biologia Evolutiva, Spain) and Dr. Borja Esteve-Altava\ufffd\ufffd(Institut Cavanilles de Biodiversitat i Biologia Evolutiva, Spain).<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>DATES: April, 20-24, 2015. 34 teaching hours.\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>PLACE: \ufffd\ufffdFacilities of the Centre de Restauraci\ufffd\ufffd i Interpretaci\ufffd\ufffd de Els Hostalets de Pierola, Els hostalets de Pierola,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdBarcelona (Spain).\ufffd\ufffd [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-24T14:28:48+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>soledad.esteban</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;29c92abd.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;89d1b4f0.1410">   <title>Mares Conference: Call for papers for the S.I. in Marine Environmental Research & Registration Deadline October 12! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;89d1b4f0.1410</link>   <description> [cid:image005.jpg@01CFE2EA.1E6BCE40]<br>Mares Conference<br>Marine Ecosystems Health and Conservation<br>17-21 November 2014, Olh\ufffd\ufffdo, Portugal<br>www.maresconference.eu&lt;http://www.maresconference.eu&gt;<br>Call for papers for the Mares Conference Special Issue in Marine Environmental Research now open to all attendees who present a digital object or a poster!<br>Deadline registration extended : October 12, 2014!<br>The Mares Conference on Marine Ecosystems Health and Conservation will take place in Olh\ufffd\ufffdo, Portugal, from 17 to 21 November 2014.<br>Selected papers from the conference will be published in a special issue of Marine Environmental Research<http://www.maresconference.eu/node/4511>. All presenters (oral, digital object and poster) are encouraged to submit full length research papers<http://ees.elsevier.com/mere/default.asp?pg=login.asp>. Moreover, [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-08T11:22:17+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>MARES Conference Secretariat</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;89d1b4f0.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;ac7c9b3f.1409">   <title>Course Halifax: Introduction to Linear mixed effects models, GLMM and MCMC with R </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;ac7c9b3f.1409</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>We would like to announce the following statistics course:<br><br>Course: Introduction to Linear mixed effects models, GLMM and MCMC<br>with R<br>Location: Halifax, Canada<br>Date: 19 - 23 January 2015<br>Remaining seats: 10<br><br>Course website: http://www.highstat.com/statscourse.htm<br>Course flyer: http://www.highstat.com/Courses/Flyer2015_01Halifax.pdf<br><br>Kind regards,<br><br>Alain Zuur    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-30T17:40:03+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Highland Statistics Ltd</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;ac7c9b3f.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;c4ffe428.1409">   <title>Course Lisbon: Introduction to Linear mixed effects models, GLMM and MCMC with R </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;c4ffe428.1409</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>We would like to announce the following statistics course:<br><br>Course: Introduction to Linear mixed effects models, GLMM and MCMC with R<br>Location: Lisbon, Portugal<br>Date: 9 - 13 February, 2015<br><br>Course website: http://www.highstat.com/statscourse.htm<br>Course flyer: http://www.highstat.com/Courses/Flyer2015_2Lisbon_GLMM.pdf<br><br>Kind regards,<br><br>Alain Zuur    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-22T06:42:29-06:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Highland Statistics Ltd</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;c4ffe428.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;32e4314e.1407">   <title>2 remaining seats on stats course at Murdoch University </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;32e4314e.1407</link>   <description> There are 2 remaining seats on the following course:<br><br>Course: Data exploration, regression, GLM &amp; GAM with<br>introduction to R.<br>Location: Murdoch University. Murdoch. Australia<br>When: 28 July - 1 August, 2014<br>Course flyer: http://www.highstat.com/Courses/Flyer2014_08Murdoch.pdf<br>Registration: http://www.highstat.com/CourseReg1.htm<br>Course website: http://www.highstat.com/statscourse.htm<br><br>Kind regards,<br><br>Alain    </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-22T10:21:51+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Highland Statistics Ltd</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;32e4314e.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;14874111.1407">   <title>New book: Beginner's Guide to GAMM with R </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;14874111.1407</link>   <description> We are please to announce the following book:<br><br>Title: Beginner's Guide to GAMM with R.<br>Authors: Zuur, Saveliev, Ieno<br><br>Book website: http://www.highstat.com/BGGAMM.htm<br>Paperback, hardcover or EBook can be order (exclusively) from:<br>http://www.highstat.com/bookorder.htm<br>Table of Contents: http://www.highstat.com/BGS/GAMM/TOC_7_12.pdf<br><br>Keywords:<br>In this book we take the reader on an exciting voyage into the world of<br>generalised additive mixed effects models (GAMM). Keywords are GAM,<br>mgcv, gamm4, random effects, Poisson and negative binomial GAMM, gamma<br>GAMM, binomial GAMM, negative binomial-P models, GAMMs with generalised<br>extreme value distributions, overdispersion, underdispersion,<br>two-dimensional smoothers, zero-inflated GAMMs, spatial correlation,<br>INLA, Markov chain Monte Carlo techniques, JAGS, and two-way [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-16T11:04:43+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Highland Statistics Ltd</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;14874111.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;4c8658f7.1405">   <title>Course: Introduction to GAM and GAMM with R </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESTUARINE-SCIENCE;4c8658f7.1405</link>   <description> We would like to announce the following stats course:<br><br>Course: Introduction to Generalized Additive Models and Generalized<br>Additive Mixed Effects Models with R<br>Where: Deakin University, Melbourne, Australia<br>When: 25 -
